title: Associate Osteopath
content:
Job Description:
Are you a fully qualified Osteopath looking to kickstart your career or move it to the next level?
Our clinic is thriving, and we are looking for the right candidate to join us at the clinic and help us treat our waiting list of new patients!

Why us?
We are a small, but growing team based in Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands. We‚Äôre looking for one associate to join our tribe! We understand the importance of working in a supportive environment, as your early years in practice will shape the rest of your career! That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre passionate about giving you the best possible start by providing you with the mentoring and tools you need to thrive in practice.

Who we want to work with?
Are you a happy, fun person, full of life, vitality, passion and purpose? If yes - we want to work with you!

What we‚Äôre offering...
‚Ä¢ Part time, self-employed position consisting of a mix of AM & PM shifts offering great work/life balance. There is the opportunity to progress to a full-time contract for the right person.
‚Ä¢ Fantastic earning potential. Security of a guaranteed basic salary, plus achievable bonuses.
‚Ä¢ Dedicated marketing department generating all the patients you could wish for.
‚Ä¢ Ongoing regular coaching and training - technique, attraction, conversion, retention and running a successful operational wellness centre. Easily cover your CPD requirements for learning with others in-house.
‚Ä¢ We have exceptional systems and a highly trained support team, meaning you can concentrate on what you do best ‚Äì providing outstanding patient care.
‚Ä¢ Online booking, payments and dedicated front of house meaning you don‚Äôt have to deal with taking payments!
‚Ä¢ Community events both in-house and digital.
‚Ä¢ A warm and friendly team who genuinely CARE about each other.

What we‚Äôre looking for...
We‚Äôre looking for an outstanding clinician who is bursting with enthusiasm & keen to get busy, adding value to our existing services & benefitting from our wide network of contacts and opportunities.

Click the link below,
https://recruitment.clusker.co.uk/

Watch the video, read more about the job,
If you like what you see, APPLY NOW!

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
Osteopath - The Holmes Clinic - Whangarei & Waipu - Northland, New Zealand 

We are on the lookout for a motivated osteopath to join our team and step into an existing caseload, as one of our colleagues is heading off for further studies. 

About us:
Based across two locations, we provide care to a diverse case load from high performing athletes to those more experienced in life. Our team prides itself on delivering high-quality, patient centred care in a friendly and welcoming clinic. 

We also have a sports focus, working closely with local rugby and football teams. This is both in clinic & pitch-side work (trainings & game days). 

Who are we looking for?
We welcome applications from both new graduates and experienced osteopaths. If you are enthusiastic, professional and passionate about osteopathy, rehabilitation & osteopathy in sports, you will be a great fit 

How to apply?
Please send your CV and Cover Letter to Neil at neil.sportosteo@gmail.com

title: Discover Your Best Life in Christchurch, New Zealand.
content:
Are you an Osteopath looking for a fresh start in one of the world‚Äôs most liveable and 
naturally beautiful cities? 

At Cashmere Osteo, we‚Äôre offering more than just a job - we‚Äôre inviting you to build a rewarding career and lifestyle here in Christchurch, New Zealand. 

We‚Äôre a thriving, purpose-built clinic with four modern treatment rooms, a warm and supportive team culture, and a strong focus on professional growth and genuine work‚Äìlife balance. 

What We Offer 
‚Ä¢ A generous salary and relocation package. 
‚Ä¢ Visa and immigration support - we‚Äôve successfully guided UK osteopaths through the process, 
and as UK graduates ourselves (BCOM), we know exactly how to make the move seamless. 
‚Ä¢ Regular CPD, mentorship, and professional development - we‚Äôre committed to helping you 
reach your full potential. 
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and support for a healthy work‚Äìlife balance. 
‚Ä¢ Personal assistance finding accommodation and settling into Christchurch. 

Whether you‚Äôre dreaming of a permanent move or looking for a few years of adventure abroad, this is your chance to experience professional fulfilment and an incredible lifestyle. 

Nestled between the mountains and the sea, Christchurch offers the perfect mix of city sophistication and outdoor adventure. 

Our clinic sits in the leafy suburb of Cashmere, close to caf√©s, riverside walks, tennis courts, and the stunning Port Hills. The Christchurch Adventure Park is just minutes away - with mountain biking, hiking, and ziplining on your doorstep. On weekends, you can surf at the beach, ski in the Southern Alps, or explore world-class vineyards - all within easy reach. 

If you‚Äôre ready to combine your passion for osteopathy with an exceptional New Zealand lifestyle, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Contact: Tim Belcher - Clinic Manager
E:  tim@cashmereosteo.co.nz   
W: www.cashmereosteo.co.nz

title: Osteopath
content:
As an associate osteopath you will bring your knowledge and skills to a multidisciplinary health clinic working alongside a friendly team of osteopaths, acupuncturists and massage therapists. The ideal candidate would be comfortable treating patients structurally (ability to perform spinal adjustments is a bonus but not necessary, the same for treating babies). Our clinic is located in an affluent area of the Auckland city and is close to local beaches and 15-minute drive from Auckland CBD. You can visit our website on www.eastbayosteo.co.nz 

As a well established clinic you will be building a busy list within 4-8 weeks and we offer ongoing clinical support and marketing strategies to help. This position would suit both an experienced osteopath as well as a new graduate and can be based on either salary or contract basis. We offer very competitive rates and salary relative to our local market. If this sounds like your next step we would love to hear from you. Please send your CV to info@eastbayosteo.co.nz.

title: Osteopath wanted in Blagnac, SW France
content:
- Role available for a part-time (2 days a week, or 3 days if you wish to work on Saturdays), motivated, self-employed Osteopath working as part of a team of two in Blagnac, Toulouse, in the South West of France. 

- The role is to take over the busy list of my colleague who will be leaving at the end of November this year. We run a bilingual (French, English) practice and we treat a wide range of patients from sports injuries, to women‚Äôs health, to children and babies, as well the elderly. 

- I set the practice up in 2012. My colleague and I have worked together for 8 years serving a multi-national community and enjoy supporting our patients, by being able to discuss and treat patients together as necessary. We have good relationships with other local medical and paramedical professionals. We share the building with two other practitioners (psychosomatic therapist and TCM practitioner for children).

- Ideally to start one day a week in November to be able to facilitate a smooth transfer for patients and to allow you to settle in to how the practice runs. New graduates welcome to apply.

- Toulouse is a vibrant city to live in with easy access to the countryside. The Pyrenees, for hiking and skiing are within close proximity, as well as the Mediterranean Sea and Atlantic Ocean.

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
Keen, committed Osteopath required in King‚Äôs Lynn, Norfolk for permanent position, either part-time or full-time. We‚Äôre looking for a skilled and enthusiastic practitioner for our small, friendly team, able to develop good patient relationships and provide top quality care to them. 

We‚Äôll support you, value your skills, encourage your ambition and give you the professional freedom to work in a way that suits you. We‚Äôre a team of osteopaths, chiropractors and soft tissue experts keen to work collaboratively with you, with an experienced front-desk team to do the day-to-day admin and make your life easier!

We welcome either an experienced osteopath or a new graduate. Our current clinicians all have many years experience both in practice in general and within this clinic specifically. Any of our clinicians will be happy to talk to you about their experience of working here! 

The King‚Äôs Lynn Chiropractic Clinic has been established for many years, and serves the town of about 40,000 plus the surrounding area. The clinic offers therapeutic ultrasound, and there is also an exercise/rehab space for someone who wishes to develop this aspect of their career.

King‚Äôs Lynn is a short drive from Thetford forest, Royal Sandringham and the nature reserves of the North Norfolk coast, but within an hour of Norwich and Cambridge: https://www.visitwestnorfolk.com andhttps://norfolk.muddystilettos.co.uk/best-places-to-live/norfolk/kings-lynn/. Accommodation in this attractive area is easy to find and inexpensive!
This is an ideal opportunity for someone who:
- wants the professional freedom to work in a way suitable to them
- wants to work alongside experienced colleagues

Check out our website, and Facebook and Twitter feeds!

title: Associate Osteopath/Osteopaths (Reigate & East Grinstead)
content:
Another fully qualified Osteopath(s) to join our growing team, in Reigate & East Grinstead - initially providing maternity cover, but will lead to a permanent position.
We prefer a primarily structural approach, but you should be comfortable with a wide variety of other treatments.
A Sports/Pitchside First Aid qualification is required (we can help you get this) for pitchside work with the rugby team.
Keen interest in sports injuries and rehab, and excited to work with athletes. Willingness to actively promote yourself and the clinic, including attending local events.
Reliable transport is essential, as our Reigate clinic is located outside the town, and you'll need to travel to local clubs and events. 

Self-employed role with some flexibility in hours/times.
2 days per week per clinic, or for separate roles 2 days in East Grinstead, and 2-3 days in Reigate. 
Opportunity to work independently, but still benefit from regular mentoring and support.
Commitment to your growth and development.
Active participation in clinic life ‚Äì we welcome your ideas and feedback.
Scope to grow your role as we look to expand in Reigate and East Grinstead. 

We are a small but growing clinic, based in Reigate, Surrey & East Grinstead, West Sussex, involved with local sports clubs and looking for a great person to join us on our journey as we develop and evolve.  

We are dedicated to helping individuals recover from injury & rediscover their passions.
We believe that educating clients about their body & the reasons behind their clinic visit is critical.

We stay up-to-date on current treatments & research, recently investing in a Class IV laser to enhance our clients' recovery. Although we specialise in sports injuries, every individual who comes through our doors is equally important to us.

If you're interested in this opportunity, please send your covering letter and CV to welcome@remedyhealthclinic.co.uk  

Ideal start date Mid November

title: Clinic for Sale UK
content:
Clinic for sale in Totnes, Devon. The clinic has a strong tradition of using cranial and functional osteopathy.
It would suit a young osteopath who likes to be in this beautiful area and to develop professionally amongst a lovely supportive community.

title: Osteopath wanted for NZ - Mountain Life, Have An Adventure!
content:
Cromwell Osteopathy has been established for 10 years now, and has become a very busy clinic in rural NZ. This is a great location to work, you are close to popular destinations like Queenstown and Wanaka. If you like the outdoors, you are able snowboard/ski, tramp/hike and hit the lake in Summer. 

The clinic has three treatment rooms, is multi disciplinary with a physiotherapist and massage therapist. 

The role is PT, 3 days per week, lots of flexibility, with plenty of room for growth. Mentoring is available if so desired. New grads welcome to apply. A structural approach is preferred. 

Start date is Nov/Dec 2025 - however we are happy to wait for the right person.

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
Associate osteopath required for busy semi-rural, long-established practice in Pewsey, Wiltshire. This is less than an hour from London by train.
Initially, I'm offering 2 days per week, but this expected to grow over time. I have good relationships with local osteopathic practices slightly further afield in Chippenham and Bradford on Avon - between us we may be able to give someone full time hours if youre happy to work at multiple locations.
My clinic is predominately MSK, patients are accustomed to STW/GOT/HVT style of treatment, but we also do cranial and visceral work where required. I am supported by a sports massage therapist and another osteopathic associate, and we have a culture of cross-referral within the clinic to support the patients to the best of our combined abilities. If you bring skills we have't got, thats great!
We have great working relationships with the local GP surgeries.
Fee split is based on experience.
I am open to new graduates applying, but equally happy to have osteopaths with more experience too.

title: Associate osteopath (Maidstone, Kent, UK)
content:
I'm looking for a friendly, confident, compassionate osteopath with strong communication skills to join our warm, supportive team at Bearsted Osteopathic Clinic, based in Mote House retirement village, surrounded by the beautiful Mote Park.
The peaceful surroundings make for a truly enjoyable working environment & perfect for relaxed outdoor lunch breaks.
As a clinic, we welcome patients of all ages, from babies to older adults, offering a well-rounded, whole-family approach. We have 1-2 clinic days per week available to start (Room to increase as demand allows) with flexible weekday or weekend slots on a percentage-based arrangement.

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, caring, and motivated osteopath, to join our busy clinic and help us to meet local demand.

Ideally for 2-4 days a week, however this is negotiable. 

We are a friendly and busy, patient centred practice in a lovely village on the outskirts of Bedford and we also have clinic space within a thriving local health and fitness club. North Beds Osteopaths has been established for over 35 years and you would be joining a team of five osteopaths.

title: Well-Established Osteopathy Clinic for Sale ‚Äì Prime London Location
content:
A unique opportunity to acquire a fully operational and reputable osteopathy clinic in a high-footfall area of London, West Hampstead. The practice has a loyal patient base, excellent online presence, and is equipped with premium medical devices including a Storz Shockwave machine, K-Laser Cube 4, and a Philips Sparq ultrasound scanner.
This turnkey clinic is ideal for a practitioner or investor looking to expand their presence or establish themselves in the UK market. Full transition support available. All patient records are stored on JaneApp (cloud-based practice software). Serious enquiries only.

title: Osteopath Manchester
content:
Join Our Dynamic Team at Fern Clinic

Are you an ambitious and driven Osteopath looking to take your career to the next level? Fern Clinic in Hale, South Manchester, is seeking a passionate therapist to join our thriving team. If you're eager to develop your skills, become an expert at treating complex injuries, and grow alongside a supportive and driven team, this is the opportunity for you!

Why Fern Clinic?

Career Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Enjoy funded CPD training to stay at the forefront of the latest treatment modalities including IDD Therapy, Shockwave Therapy, TECAR Therapy, MRI interpretation and APPI Pilates to advance your expertise.

Supportive Team Environment: Work alongside a collaborative and enthusiastic team that values mutual support and shared success. Your contributions will be recognised and rewarded.

Expertise in Complex Cases: Specialise in treating complex spinal injuries with IDD Therapy and expand your knowledge and skills to position yourself as an expert in spinal care.

Rewarding Experience: Your hard work will be rewarded with competitive remuneration and opportunities for advancement. We believe in recognising and appreciating the dedication and talent of our team members.

Location: Fern Clinic is based in the upmarket village of Hale in Altrincham, South Manchester. You will be close to the exciting hustle and bustle of Manchester with its many bars and restaurants. For nature lovers there are numerous areas of outstanding natural beauty within driving distance such as Cheshire, the Lake District, Peak District and Yorkshire Dales.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

A driven individual with a passion for developing their skills and expertise.
A proactive individual who thrives in a collaborative and supportive environment.
Attention to detail with an interest in solving tricky cases.
Dedication to providing high-quality care with an interest in treating complex injuries.

Role
Treatment: Provide hands on treatment and learn to administer state of the art medical technology to treat complex injuries including IDD Therapy, Shockwave Therapy and TECAR Therapy.
Rehabilitation: Create and demonstrate effective rehabilitation plans to optimise patient recovery.
Collaboration: Work closely with our team to monitor patient progress and provide excellent care for complex cases.
Marketing: Create informative social media content and videos.
Communication: Be confident in communicating diagnosis, advice and treatment plans to patients.
Administrative Tasks: Schedule appointments, take and record payments, be accurate and timely at documenting patient notes, prepare letters and documentation as requested.

Minimum requirements
Bachelors or Master‚Äôs degree in Osteopathy
Registration with the associated regulatory body (GOSC)
New graduates welcome to apply
Candidate must be eligible to work in the UK and must be able to speak an advanced level of English

At Fern Clinic, we believe that exceptional care starts with a great team. If you're ready to make a difference and grow with us, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

We look forward to hearing from you!

The Osteopathic Centre Singapore (The Osteo SG) is an award-winning osteopathic practice with three locations across Singapore. Founded in 2008 by Dr. Paul Bell and a team of international osteopaths, we have been dedicated to supporting families' overall health and well-being. title: Locum/Associate/Sale of Goodwill
content:
I am looking for someone to step into my shoes! Initially this role could begin with locum support for my practice in July August time 2025, while I will be out of action following surgeries. I can support you during this time and if you were a new graduate then I can mentor you. This work could then nicely introduce you to my patients and you could stay in the practice part time until about July 2026. That's my exit date. I'm off to New Zealand!
I don't have a clinic location to sell you but I work in two locations and both will be available for you to take on. The sale of goodwill will be a full and robust endorsement from me via email to my clients who are all avid readers of my posts on mailchimp. There is also a website available and clinic telephone number with reception service set up. Most important to me is to find the right person to step into my shoes and look after my patients. My patients are a mix of middle aged and elderly, farmers, trades people and avid sports players exactly as you'd expect in a semi rural setting.
This role would suit someone who likes to work under their own initiative. You should be good at structural techniques with lots of soft tissue work and the following skills would also be useful to you: Cranial, Dry Needling, Laser Therapy.

Locum role in July 2025 - 1 day in Pulborough, 2 -3 days in Graffham Monday to Friday including 1 evening.
Possible 2 day associate style position from September 2025 to July 2026
July 2026 - Sale of goodwill of busy rural two location practice full of lovely regular clients with a good flow of new patients for sole osteopath.

www.annashawcross.co.uk

Please send expressions of interest to hello@annashawcross.co.uk I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Osteopathic Practitioner
content:
Vitality BioMed is a multidisciplinary clinic dedicated to providing compassionate, patient-centered care in a beautifully appointed space in Calgary, AB. Our mission is to uncover and treat the root cause of health concerns, offering a welcoming and supportive environment where both patients and practitioners thrive. We offer a full spectrum of advanced diagnostic testing and holistic treatments ensuring a comprehensive and integrative approach to healing. 

We are seeking a self-motivated, compassionate and skilled Osteopathic Practitioner to join our incredible team!

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢	Conduct comprehensive patient assessments, including medical history, lifestyle evaluation, and physical examinations, to identify underlying health concerns.
‚Ä¢	Develop and implement individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient‚Äôs needs.
‚Ä¢	Perform osteopathic treatments, including manual therapy, soft tissue techniques, and joint mobilization.
‚Ä¢	Monitor patient progress, adjust treatment plans as needed, and provide ongoing support and follow-up care.
‚Ä¢	Collaborate with other practitioners within the clinic, as well as conventional medical doctors and specialists, to ensure integrated, whole-body care.
‚Ä¢	Educate patients on self-care techniques, rehabilitation exercises, and lifestyle modifications to support long-term wellness.
‚Ä¢	Maintain accurate and detailed patient records of consultations, assessments, and treatments using an EMR system.
  
Qualifications & Skills
‚Ä¢	Graduate of an accredited osteopathic training program.
‚Ä¢	Licensed or registered to practice as an Osteopathic Practitioner in Alberta.
‚Ä¢	In-depth knowledge of osteopathic principles, manual therapies, and musculoskeletal health.
‚Ä¢	Strong understanding of anatomy, physiology, and biomechanics.
‚Ä¢	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build trust with patients and collaborate effectively with other healthcare professionals.
‚Ä¢	Compassionate, patient-centered approach with a commitment to holistic healing.
‚Ä¢	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess complex conditions and develop effective treatment plans.
‚Ä¢	Organizational skills to manage patient caseloads, maintain accurate records, and schedule appointments efficiently.
‚Ä¢	Dedication to ongoing education and staying current with advancements in osteopathic medicine.

Why Join Vitality BioMed?
‚Ä¢	Established, multidisciplinary clinic with a supportive team and a growing patient base.
‚Ä¢	Access to advanced diagnostic testing and innovative treatments that accelerate healing.
‚Ä¢	Exceptional support staff to assist in building a thriving practice.
‚Ä¢	Use of Jane EMR system for seamless scheduling and patient management.
‚Ä¢	Competitive compensation
‚Ä¢	Comprehensive marketing support, including social media promotion, website features, newsletters, and networking opportunities.

If you are a passionate and dedicated Naturopathic Doctor looking to grow your practice in a collaborative, innovative, and patient-focused environment, we would love to hear from you!

One to two years of post graduate experience is preferred but not essential new graduates will be provided with mentoring and guidance to help improve skills and knowledge as an osteopath. It is expected the applicant  takes professional responsibility as an Osteopath, with decision-making, autonomy, and clinical-reasoning skills, to triage, assess, diagnose, and treat a designated clinical caseload.

Expectations of Applicant 

Take responsibility for continued professional development as required by the GOSC.
Excellent organisational and time management skills is imperative.
Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
To work some evenings. 
To actively promote oneself to increase client base. 

The aim is to create a small team that provides exceptional standard of osteopathic care whilst providing a friendly working atmosphere.

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
We are looking for a keen, enthusiastic and approachable osteopath to join our growing team and clinic on a self employed basis. The clinic is multi-faceted offering osteopathy, pilates, personal training, rehab, mummy mot, massage, reiki, reflexology, gait scan and orthotics. 
Located in the heart of Beaconsfield Old Town in beautiful grade 2 listed barn. You can see our space at Beaconsfieldhealthhub.com

You will be expected to provide the very highest standard of care to both self paying and insurance patients taking them from initial case history, assessment through to treatment, rehab and discharge. 

Communication and is key, and you'll build long lasting relationships with your patient base and work along side our multi-faceted teams. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
To take professional responsibility as an Osteopath, with high level decision-making, autonomy, and clinical-reasoning skills, to triage, assess, diagnose, and treat a designated clinical caseload.
A highly confident, consultative approach with new clients to prescribe and plan effective treatments to deliver lasting outcomes.
To attract and retain clients at excellent levels, with an exceptional active patient management approach.
Building and maintaining excellent referral relationships with external partnerships (sports clubs, gym instructors, PT‚Äôs), and consultants.

To continually develop as an Osteopath abiding with your CPD which should include attending external conferences and events that are beneficial to your own professional development.

To communicate effectively with referring parties so that all clients receive continued and uninterrupted care. 

Abide by the GOsC Code of Practice.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/ QUALIFICATIONS
BSc (Hons) Osteopathy Degree
Full registration with the GOsC and a clear professional record. 
Ability to work autonomously.

Evidence of your continued professional development. 
Excellent organisational and time management skills.
Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.


DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS 
Experience in generating new business and your own client caseload. 
Experience of practicing in the private healthcare sector. 
1+ years relevant post graduate clinical experience.
Dry Needling and Sports Massage qualifications are preferable. 

We aim to have monthly team meet ups for CPD, that may include some sort of fitness, yoga combined with case studies and patient discussion... and pizza to fuel it.

title: Associated Osteopath East London Hackney
content:
Wednesday afternoon; Friday afternoon and Sunday all day shift available from January 2025; Friday afternoon available from November 2024.

Are you a passionate and skilled osteopath looking to join a dynamic team in the heart of Hackney, London? Our small but busy clinic is expanding, and we are seeking a talented osteopath to enhance our practice.

Located in one of London's trendiest areas, we specialize in pre- and post-natal care as well as paediatric treatments, while also catering to a diverse range of patients of all ages and backgrounds. Our clinic is frequented by health-conscious young professionals and families, and we see a wide spectrum of ailments, including:

- Visceral and hormonal imbalances

content:

TOMClinic is a friendly and professional practice known for delivering exceptional patient-centred care.  We are mainly a structural practice with a wide variety of presentations and typical population range of 16 - 90+.

content:
We are looking for a motivated and ambitious osteopath to join our team.  The right candidate will be taking over a busy list due to one of our fabulous associates leaving us after 7 years.  We are a friendly, encouraging team and give osteopaths the space to grow as independent practitioners but also offer more structured mentoring to suit. We are in a gorgeous location in Holmfirth Yorkshire with close links to Leeds and Manchester.  Hours and days negotiated and flexible to suit the right person.  Please get in touch.

title: Manual Osteopath
content:
Seeking passionate and skilled Manual Osteopath
Nova Scotia, Canada

Make a career move you'll never regret by applying to join our dedicated and supportive multidisciplinary team. Our beautiful clinic is in the spectacular seaside town of Mahone Bay, where we have built a reputation for helping patients find solutions to complex problems.


About our clinic:

Our team consists of three Manual Osteopaths plus Physiotherapists, Massage Therapists, TCM Practitioners, Social Worker/SE Therapists, a Naturopathic Doctor, as well as Grief and Loss Support. We offer unique services including vestibular rehabilitation, pelvic health, exercise and education in Osteoporosis, as well as more traditional MSK care. All our practitioners work one-on-one with patients, allowing us to connect with, empower, and support them in reaching their health and wellness goals. Our patients in return tend to be ready to hear and respond to the solutions we have to offer, making this job incredibly rewarding.

About the position:

Applicants must be qualified to register with the NSAO and have a desire to continue learning and growing in their field. You will have on-site administrative support, as well as collaborative learning opportunities with other practitioners.

The position is full-time, permanent. The successful candidate can choose between an employee or independent contractor arrangement. Remuneration is above average.

Website: www.zenithphysiopilates.com
Please send cover letter and CV in confidence to: rebecca@zenithphysiopilates.com

title: Associate Osteopaths Wanted in Devon
content:
Osteo and Physio are Recruiting in Devon!
The winners of the IO innovation award 2022 are looking for the right Osteopath to join our busy group of clinics in Devon.
If you‚Äôre looking to live in a beautiful part of the world with incredible countryside and spectacular coast then look no further. We‚Äôve got several incredible positions available for the right person across clinics in East Devon and Somerset.

‚Äì Track record: Across our clinics in the Southwest we see nearly 4000 patients per month meaning we know how to get you busy.

‚Äì Get busy: Priority over all new patients until your list is fully booked.

‚Äì Career pathways: Clear career progression pathways with opportunities for senior clinical roles, specialisations and clinic ownership.
‚Äì Flexibility: 2-5 days available with opportunity to split days across 2 different clinics so you can work alongside many other experienced Osteopaths, Physios and Sports therapists.
‚Äì Amazing environments: Our clinics are fully equipped, beautifully renovated and air conditioned.

We‚Äôre looking for one or two Osteopaths to start anytime within the next 6 months. So if you are looking to work in a busy and professional clinic, with incredible support and career progression opportunities then please send your CV to Oliver at operations@osteoandphysio.co.uk or by calling 07772424477.

title: Associate Osteopath in Falmouth, Cornwall, UK
content:
The Role / The Clinic 
The role will be taking on a partial patient list with both private and NHS (AQP) patients. The initial offer is of 1.5 days per week, however, there is scope to quickly add to your patient list due a high demand of MSK services in the local and surrounding areas. 

CPD opportunities are available. 

We are looking to interview as soon as possible and to have the right candidate start before the end of 2024. The role will be on a self-employed, fee-split basis which will be discussed in greater depth as a part of the interview process. 

Falmouth Osteopathic Clinic has been a part of the Cornish community since 1932 and has a strong relationship with local GP surgeries and other healthcare practitioners. The team consists of a Reception/Administration team, Osteopaths, a Podiatrist, Clinical Pilates, and a Soft Tissue Therapist. The practitioners within Falmouth Osteopathic Clinic Ltd have a patient-centred, research-informed approach to healthcare. 

The Candidate
A reliable, self-sufficient Osteopath who would like to integrate into multidisciplinary team within a busy clinic. A minimum of one years' post-graduate clinical experience is preferred. 

Additional qualifications that would complement your application: Massage Therapy, Acupuncture/dry needling, Exercise-rehabilitation. 

You must have impeccable communication skills and be proficient with letter writing. A proactive attitude towards self-development, professional development, and an interest to connect with the community through networking and events.

title: Structural Osteopath Needed in a very Busy Professional Clinic in Auckland
content:
Please check our website:   www.sportsosteopath.co.nz



We are looking for a highly energetic and enthusiastic structural osteopath to join our clinic at our state of the art facility in early 2025.

The clinic is located in a large modern complex with other professional businesses. The clinic is very well setup and has multiple air conditioned and sound-insulated treatment rooms, multiple carparks, fulltime reception cover, a staff room, a children‚Äôs playroom, Wifi, a full automatic coffee machine and seated courtyard with water fountains.

Botany Specialist Sports Osteopath is well established clinic that has been serving the community in East Auckland for the past 15 years, with an excellent referral base and a great reputation in the community for delivering high quality osteopathic care and fast results. We treat a large variety of patients, ranging from new born babies, pregnant women and elderly patients, to elite international athletes and dedicated sports enthusiasts.

We offer a relaxed, supportive and professional environment for patients, staff members and practitioners, and are consistently striving to improve our clinic and service. We are well known in the community for going the extra mile to help our patients, and have a 95% word of mouth referral base for new patients.

We use Cliniko software which is a cloud based patient management system, together with online booking and txt to remind. We also file online ACC forms and online digital billing. We also have full access to all private imaging companies to access patient‚Äôs X-rays and scans. Full training will be provided on all of the above.

We are committed to helping all of our team to reach their professional potential, and provide all the support necessary for you to reach your goals in a caring, fun and supportive environment. We will provide consistent support to our practitioners and mentor them to build their clinical skills and be the best practitioners they can be. There will be structured meetings with guidance in both clinical and business management. You will be part of a team that values a constant improvement mentality, professionalism and strives for excellence.

Potential earnings $100,000 to $170,000 NZD for the right candidate who is willing to go the extra mile to help patients and handle a 50-60 patient/week load.

Candidates must be registered with the Osteopathic Council of New Zealand to start practicing in the clinic, preferable to have a minimum of two years clinical experience, and are committed to permanently living and working in New Zealand.

Please get in contact with us with your CV if you are interested in the position.
Email: osteocare@yahoo.co.nz

The Tilsworth Clinic, located in Chalfont St Giles, provides first-class osteopathy through a range of treatments and services for the local South Buckinghamshire communities. We are a well-established clinic with an ever-growing list of both long-time patients and new patients of all ages, who come to us for help with a range of acute and chronic issues. We spend time with each patient and carry out careful, in-depth assessments to understand the health issue, pain or discomfort that they are experiencing. We are committed to providing high-quality treatment, advice, and support, in order to deliver long-term benefits to our patients. The current practitioners use a variety of techniques both direct and indirect. Sports massage is also available from one on the personal trainers.

As the clinic is part of a private gym, any functional or rehab work with patients can both be carried out within the treatment room or the quiet and spacious gym. PTs are also working on the premises and available to collaborate with the osteopaths and physios on rehab plans. This is particularly useful for patients who also wish to maintain their levels of health and wellbeing by offering regular personal training session tailored to their needs assessed by the osteopaths/physios.  Website: https://thetilsworthclinic.co.uk/

Location

The Tilsworth Clinic is located on the High Street of Chalfont St Giles, just a 10-minute drive from Beaconsfield, Chalfont & Latimer station, Amersham station, and Gerard Cross station (23-minute train to London Marylebone station).

The role

We are looking for a new associate osteopath to join our team on a part-time basis. Ideally looking for someone to cover at least 2 days to begin with and increase to 3. The working days and working hours for this role are very flexible and can also be half days spread across the week.

The new associate osteopath will be expected to:

¬∑ provide high-quality osteopathic assessment, diagnosis, evaluation, treatment and advice to patients, including those with complex conditions or multi pathology

¬∑ make patients feel comfortable, heard, and supported

¬∑ maintain patient records and information to reflect the state and progress of their condition, as well as the care provided

¬∑ work autonomously without direct assistance or supervision*

¬∑ abide by the Clinic‚Äôs rules and regulations, including the Terms and Policies.

*Training will of course be provided when the successful candidate starts to work at the Tilsworth clinic. This will include training on the use of Cliniko (software used to safely store and update patient data, and to book and manage patient appointments when needed).

Salary

¬£19,200 for 2 days per week plus bonus. The salary will be discussed depending on times and days committed as these are flexible and can be increased from the 2 days.

Requirements

¬∑ GOsC registration

¬∑ Professional insurance

¬∑ New graduates welcome

¬∑ Evidence of up-to-date CPD

¬∑ Excellent manual therapy, clinical reasoning skills & soft tissue skills

Other areas of interest

- Rehab (sports or other): working alongside excellent PTs and sports massage therapist.

- Animal osteopathy: For those interested in postgraduate animal programmes. Shadowing of practice principle treating animals will be offered as well as equine patient handover. She has completed the UCO PG.cert and the Animal osteopathy international Diploma awarded by ESO. This part of the business can be passed on separately from the work at the clinic.

Job Type: Part-time

Part-time hours: 24-32hr per week

Salary: ¬£19,200.00 per year based on 24hrs per week

Benefits:

¬∑ Flexitime

¬∑ On-site gym

¬∑ On-site parking

Schedule:

¬∑ Flexitime

¬∑ Monday to Friday

¬∑ Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

¬∑ Commission pay

Work Location: In person at the clinic in Chalfont St Giles. Some work may be seeing clients at their home

Expected start date: 1/8/2024

title: Osteopath
content:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are
Eastbay Osteo in Auckland, New Zealand, are looking for full-time structural-focused osteopath(s). Eastbay Osteo is an established osteopathic clinic offering top quality osteopathy, acupuncture and massage services. We deal with both injury related patients as well as those who come to see us for prevention and improving/maintaining their physical health. You can find more info about us in our website www.eastbayosteo.co.nz

What you‚Äôll do
Employing your set of skills and experience, delivering high quality osteopathic service to our patients to achieve the best clinical outcome.
Your typical day as one of our osteopaths will involve:
‚Ä¢ Arriving ten minutes before the first patient to set up the treatment room, clinical notes and software program
‚Ä¢ Taking case history from patients regarding their general health and body area(s) of interest (painful area or injury site)
‚Ä¢ Performing necessary physical and medical examination(s) to identify the cause of symptoms and discussing your finding with your patients
‚Ä¢ Considering clients‚Äô need and treatment preference and drawing an intervention plan within the scope of osteopathy as outlined by the Osteopathic Council of New Zealand (OCNZ) which is then discussed with the client
‚Ä¢ Communication with clients to achieve the most effective health outcome
‚Ä¢ Arranging appropriate referral (internal and external) to other health practitioners including referrals to specialists and for radiology scans
‚Ä¢ Responsible for rebooking/scheduling clients and dealing with payments when receptionist is not present
‚Ä¢ Setting up and cleaning the room between clients and after each shift

Where you‚Äôll fit in
Based at Eastbay Osteo located on 132 West Tamaki Road, Auckland.

Work hours and days
Minimum of 30 hours per week (Monday to Friday, a combination of morning (08:00 AM ‚Äì 02:30 PM) and afternoon (02:00 ‚Äì 07:30 PM) shifts as well as Saturday morning shifts (8:00 AM ‚Äì 12:30 PM)

Work Pay:
This position will be based on minimum 30 hours full-time permanent employment. We will offer the most compatible salaries in the local market with extra appealing benefits and bonuses offered. . 

What you‚Äôll bring with you
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and passion for osteopathy to help patients
‚Ä¢ Registration with OCNZ and holding a current valid indemnity insurance
‚Ä¢ Professionalism and team work attitude working in a multi-disciplinary clinic
‚Ä¢ Customer service and people skills
‚Ä¢ Time management skills
‚Ä¢ Active self-marketing and rebooking of clients to maintain a busy client list
‚Ä¢ Proactive involvement in regular clinical meetings with other practitioners
‚Ä¢ Communication with other health providers for internal and external referrals

Why join us
At Eastbay Osteo, we are a team of friendly and professional health providers with extensive experience and knowledge. We offer ongoing clinical support and marketing strategies (individually and as a business) to ensure a happy and healthy work place for all our staff and clients. We also offer a competitive salary and bonuses relative to New Zealand market. Our clinic is a 15 minutes-drive from Auckland CBD and is very close to all the Eastern beaches.

How to apply
Send us an email at info@eastbayosteo.co.nz. Put your cover letter in the body of your email and attach your CV. We look forward to hearing from you!

We are are looking for someone ideally with a strong structural approach and is a bonus if they have a cranial or visceral skill set in addition. Ideally 2 years minimum experience required but open to take on someone with less experience if they have the right attitude and approach to growth. 

The clinic is open Monday- Saturday, with your diary consisting of 2 full days, 3 half days and every alternating Saturday.

Base salary of 72,000 SGD with the potential to earn up to 200,000 SGD with commission on top
You need to be registered with GOSC, AHPRA or OCNZ.

Our patients vary from professional athletes to mums and babies, with your city workers and weekend warriors in between. 

Singapore is an awesome place to live and the best part is having SE asia on your door step for long weekends away. We encourage travel and making the most of the lifestyle out here.

title: Self Employed Female Osteopathic Associate (Genuine Occupational Requirement)
content:
I am seeking a female self-employed osteopathic associate to join Osteopathy London (osteopathylondon.co.uk), an established clinic in Bethnal Green at the heart of London‚Äôs East End.

The female only specific nature of this advert comes only after consulting our insurer, the IO, and the Equalities Act, before concluding that it is a Genuine Occupational Requirement proportionate to assist us to better serve our diverse local community.

You will be associate to myself, John Mallinder, and in joining together with my excellent associate Gervais this will bring to our community accessibility that is otherwise limited by our being two male practitioners.

I‚Äôve been in practice since 1998 and taught for a number of years in the student Clinic of the British College of Osteopathic Medicine.

After a period building my manual, cranial and paediatric skills as an associate, I established my own practice in Bethnal Green in 2001. In 2011 I opened The Plane Tree (theplanetree.co.uk), a clinic focusing on mind and body health with my psychologist wife. As well as being the base for Osteopathy London, the clinic offers massage, acupuncture, and a variety of talking therapies.

I am a broad scope practitioner with interest and experience in cranial work and paediatrics alongside my manual osteopathic manual work. I have invested in extending my knowledge in exercise rehabilitation in the last few years.

The associate position will suit an osteopath comfortable working independently, though looking for a supportive professional relationship with a principal that will aim to develop their skills and breadth of practice, and assist them to explore their special interests.

The role:
‚Ä¢ The days required are Monday morning to lunchtime (9-2pm approx.), Friday daytime (time flexible) and Saturdays (10-5pm). Although there may be some flexibility for the right candidate in which weekdays and times are worked, Saturdays are required.
‚Ä¢ The associate will retain 62% of new patient fees and 57.5% of existing patient fees.
‚Ä¢ There is a ¬£140 minimum per session retainer regardless of patient numbers on the day.
‚Ä¢ You will receive an annual financial contribution of ¬£500 towards CPD costs made available at the end of each 12-month cycle of engagement.
‚Ä¢ You will retain 100% of fees for two weeks each year, by way of a holiday contribution from the principle.
‚Ä¢ Although I will not necessarily be present at the clinic to share challenging patients with you, I will be available to support you whenever possible.
‚Ä¢ We can organise regular meetings to discuss patients, your continued professional development, and to share techniques and ideas.

Requirements for the associate are:
‚Ä¢ New graduates are welcome to apply.
‚Ä¢ Strong osteopathic manipulative skills.
‚Ä¢ To help patients ‚Äúto appreciate both the physical dimensions and the relationship between body and mind in pain and dysfunction‚Äù as stated on our website.
‚Ä¢ Although training in the cranial approach is not essential, at least an interest in this and other subtle approaches is ideal.
‚Ä¢ A good basic understanding of exercise rehabilitation with a view to offering tailored advice to each patient would help, however before you start, I will aim to run you through some simple concepts to ensure you feel comfortable with assessing and advising patients from the very start.

Structure of the practice:
‚Ä¢ We offer consultations of an hour to allow time enough for a comprehensive level of care as a prelude to future visits.
‚Ä¢ Follow-on treatments are a standard 40mins as this enables treatment, advice and exercises to be provided in a calm and relaxed manner.
‚Ä¢ We are a reception-less practice using Cliniko as our booking system. Naturally this will involve you taking payment from patients and arranging bookings in the few instances where online booking isn‚Äôt possible.

The role will suit a practitioner that enjoys the pace a 40min appointment allows, together with the opportunities it affords for an in-depth understanding of a patient‚Äôs issues through conversation, physical examination, and engagement. Where appropriate there will be time enough within sessions to develop and evolve an exercise programme, offer the cranial approach if trained to do so, and discuss relevant lifestyle concerns.

Start date : November 2023 with some flexibility.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Please forward your CV with an accompanying introduction to johnosteopathylondon@gmail.com, or your contact details if you‚Äôd prefer to chat by phone to learn more.

Regards,
John

title: Employed Associate Osteopath
content:
Join Our Team as an Employed Associate Osteopath
Are you a passionate, newly qualified osteopath looking to embark on an exciting career voyage? Do you want to be part of a friendly and professional team dedicated to delivering exceptional patient-centred care? If so, we invite you to consider joining our independent clinic in Ealing, West London

About Us:
At Health in Motion Osteopaths we are committed to helping our patients live a healthy and motioned-filled life. Our clinic is renowned for its warm and welcoming atmosphere, and we take pride in offering a solution-focused approach to osteopathy that connects with the individual needs of each patient.

Position Overview:
We are seeking an energetic Associate Osteopath to join our team. As a newly qualified osteopath with up to 2 years of post-graduation experience, you will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals and make a meaningful impact on our patients' lives.

Key Responsibilities:
- Embrace and implement the clinic's "C.A.R.E Voyage" strategy to provide effective patient-centred care.
- Collaborate with our team to grow the clinic's patient community.
- Conduct initial consultations, and provide specificable habit-forming advice and movement prescriptions.
- Use our recipe to create personalized C.A.R.E plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.
- Develop and master your own signature treatment style
- Maintain accurate electronic patient records.
- Continuously develop your skills through training and mentorship opportunities
- Participate in team events and contribute to our friendly and supportive clinic culture.

What We Offer:
- Full-time employed position with competitive salary.
- Comprehensive training, mentorship, and coaching to help you thrive in your role.
- A supportive and collaborative team environment.
- Opportunities for professional development and growth.
- Generous benefits package.
- Administration support from our Front Desk team to streamline your workflow.
- A blended approach to treatment ‚Äì Manual therapy, Acupuncture, Taping, Laser Light Therapy, Mindset Reframing

Qualifications:
- Registered with the General Osteopathic Council (GOsC).
- Newly qualified osteopath with up to 2 years of post-graduation experience.
- Strong communication and relationship-building skills.
- Passion for providing excellent and creative patient care.
- Dedication to ongoing professional development.

If you are a passionate and energetic osteopath eager to make a positive impact on the lives of our patient community, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and become a valued member of our clinic's mission to promote health and well-being within our community.

How to Apply:
To apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your qualifications, experience, and why you are passionate about osteopathy and patient-centered care. Apply on Indeed or send your application to Lola@healthinmotion.org.uk.

Health in Motion Osteopaths is an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome candidates of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. We look forward to hearing from you and exploring the possibility of you becoming part of our dedicated team!

title: Osteopath
content:
About Us

Oak Park Clinic is a health and wellbeing clinic set in the beautiful Surrey/Hampshire boarder countryside, seeking to recruit a self-employed Osteopath. Staffed reception hours are 9am to 8pm 3 days a week, 9am to 5pm 2 days a week and every other Saturday 9am to 1pm. 
The clinic is in a beautiful peaceful courtyard, located in the heart of Crondall with its bustling village community. The free parking on site makes the clinic accessible to all patients. We have developed a strong and active client list over the past two decades. 

Why should you apply for a role with Oak Park Clinic

You will join an existing team of Osteopaths, Massage Therapists, Nutritional Therapist, Acupuncturist and Counsellor.  Our philosophy is to support the whole person, and we believe a skilled and qualified multi-disciplinary team is the best way to offer this holistic approach.  We love working with our patients and know you will too!

The Practitioner Agreement is based on a 60/40 split (in favour of the Practitioner). The clinic provides full reception cover and clinic services with clean and well-equipped treatment rooms. 

Role requirements

We are looking for someone with both dedication to excellent healthcare provision, and confidence in their role.  
You will be working in the clinic as a self-employed practitioner and be responsible for providing a high standard of assessment, diagnosis, treatment, and advice to patients. Working days and hours are flexible, we can accommodate a full or part time position. 

Essential: 
‚Ä¢	Relevant degree in Osteopathy and registered with GOsC
‚Ä¢	Up to date Professional Indemnity and Public Liability insurance
‚Ä¢	Up to date DBS
‚Ä¢	Passion and enthusiasm for Osteopathy
‚Ä¢	Willingness to work in a team, sharing professional development with others and supporting the clinic‚Äôs growth

Desirable: 
‚Ä¢	Ideally 1 year Post Grad experience with an active CPD profile
‚Ä¢	Interest and relevant CPD in Paediatric and Maternity Osteopathy 
‚Ä¢	Availability to work at least one evening a week and every other Saturday morning, as well as flexible day time hours. 

Core Role responsibilities

‚Ä¢	Undertake a comprehensive assessment and formulate a diagnosis of patients presenting with a range of musculoskeletal conditions.
‚Ä¢	You will work as an autonomous practitioner taking responsibility for the management of patients on your caseload.
‚Ä¢	Maintain up to date patient documentation and records in line with Osteopathic standards and clinic policies.

title: Associate Osteopath
content:
Fantastic opportunity across two affluent areas of sunny costal Sydney!! Allied Therapies and Sydney Family Osteopaths have been working closely together for almost 10 years.

We are looking for a new associate osteopath to join our two established Eastern Suburbs and Shire clinics in Sydney with extensive patient bases. Fantastic clinic spaces with all the equipment you need and close to two great beaches!

Experienced osteos and new-graduates are encouraged to apply. Perhaps you are looking for your first role in a practice or looking for your next new clinic team to push your business forward to the next level.
As an independent contractor in our clinics, you‚Äôll have the freedom to build your own practice while benefiting from our business and marketing systems, our international network of well-known practitioners and researchers, and the steady stream of clients seeking quality care.
We believe in empowering our contractors to grow and develop their skills if they wish; which is why we can offer ongoing professional development opportunities to ensure that you are meeting our business and healthcare standards.
Candidates must have a solid structural base in but are welcome to use any other approaches they wish, you‚Äôll just need to be passionate about the role of Osteopathy within healthcare.

We are looking for a fun, personable, outgoing practitioner who has a desire to excel within private practice. Someone who is looking to develop their clinical knowledge and skills and who is eager to take on new and exciting challenges. You‚Äôll have great communication skills with both colleagues and patients. You‚Äôll be enthusiastic, motivated, keen to learn and establish your own reputation, be mature and happy to work independently.

We are a collaborative and mixed team of osteopaths and podiatrists. We love working with our community, treat all age groups, refer and liaise with other health professionals. We are always learning and developing ourselves as clinicians. And we enjoy life outside of work too!

International candidates welcome!. We are able to support and guide you through the Supervised Practise route, so as long as you can get a visa, we can get you working straight away!
Great news that recent changes to the Working Holiday Visa Scheme means anyone up to the age of 35 can apply and no longer requires the compulsory farm work to extend your visa for up to 3 years in total.

Above average remuneration
2-3 days available at each location so a full-time job for one person or shared part-time for two candidates ‚Äì flexible days but will include a Saturday morning.

Contact Kathryn for an initial chat on either 0421 812331 or sydneyfamilyosteopaths@gmail.com

You‚Äôll be part of a company that has one main goal; helping people get more out of what they want in life.

The vacancy for an osteopath has become available due to the expansion of the team and would be for a full-time permanent position. You would be reporting directly to the director, as well as working closely with the rest of the clinical and administration team.

As a valued member of the team, you would be rewarded with a fantastic base salary and be financially compensated as you grow your caseload. Maybe you want the opportunity to become more than just a standard team member because you know that you‚Äôre able to deliver much, much more? Maybe you want to learn all about the ins and outs of clinical reasoning and have a diary full of patients that absolutely love you because you're getting the very best outcomes possible for them? Our client offers the potential for all of the above to come to fruition.

You'll go through an amazing on-boarding process, so that you have the knowledge and the confidence to deliver exactly what you need to do, each and every single day, to meet your targets, and your own personal goals. You'll have access to regular ongoing training, and regular weekly catch ups, and weekly meetings.

But most of all, working with our client is fun. There's no office politics. It's just a team that loves coming to work, working together, and getting the very best outcomes for themselves and their patients.

You will have set working hours with a guideline of 40 hours per week (including Saturday mornings).
The set working hours are either 8.15am ‚Äì 1.45pm (mornings), 1:45pm ‚Äì 7:15pm (afternoons), or 8:15am ‚Äì 7:15pm

Additional Benefits
‚Ä¢ Work life freedom
‚Ä¢ Accelerated career progression
‚Ä¢ Double your patient impact
‚Ä¢ Build your skill set
‚Ä¢ Be a vital member
‚Ä¢ Monthly 1:1 meetings
‚Ä¢ Weekly communication training
‚Ä¢ Monthly Technique workshops
‚Ä¢ Weekly team meetings
‚Ä¢ CPD / Training opportunities
‚Ä¢ ¬£500 pa additional funding for external training
‚Ä¢ Work pension scheme
‚Ä¢ Company contribution of ¬£50 pm towards gym membership
‚Ä¢ Free road parking
‚Ä¢ Accessible via public transport (5 minutes walk from train station)

About You
If you‚Äôve got a passion for helping people and helping them reach their goals, you‚Äôre fantastic at communication and enjoy working as part of a dynamic team, and you‚Äôre a lightning-fast learner; then you might just be the person our client is looking for!

Perhaps you‚Äôre looking for your first role in a practice, or maybe you just aren‚Äôt fulfilled with your career so far and know that there is a better opportunity waiting for you. Our client welcomes applications from candidates from post grad to experienced in their field.

You'll be enthusiastic, driven to succeed, and motivated to grow and learn new things. This expectation from team members is delivered too by the director. The job comes with high expectations because the team go above and beyond to deliver a high quality service to its patients.

So, here are some questions to ask yourself, to see if you're fit for our client‚Äôs team. Are you super organized? Are you able to bring a mass of energy to work each and every day? Are you obsessed with getting results for each and every patient? Can you build rapport with just about anyone? If that's you, and you're still reading this advertisement, then you might just be the person that we're looking for.

If you're looking for a role that's more than just a temporary steppingstone, if you're accountable, coachable, driven and hardworking, then you need look no further. We are looking for a team player, because our client wants to invest in you, heavily, for the long term.

This role is for someone with great people skills, fantastic communication skills and enjoys working as part of a dynamic team. It's for someone who is resourceful, and has great attention to detail, with a can-do attitude. You must be coachable; you must be accountable, and you must want to get the very best out of yourself and your osteo career.
‚Ä¢ You must be a qualified Osteopath (Degree or postgraduate master's degree)
‚Ä¢ You must be approved by the General Osteopathic Council
‚Ä¢ You must be currently based in the UK with a working visa already in place
‚Ä¢ You are smart, efficient and confident.
‚Ä¢ You are extremely accountable for your outcomes.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre passionate and outgoing.
‚Ä¢ You thrive on personal development. You know the value of training and education.
‚Ä¢ You can work in a team and independently and always give 100%
‚Ä¢ You are a fun, personable, outgoing with a can do attitude

About Our Client
Our client is based in Worthing in West Sussex, the South Coast of England, where they cater for patients in Worthing and surrounding areas. They‚Äôre a well-established and progressive practice, known for delivering excellent patient outcomes in a fun and friendly environment.

With over 25 years of history, our client continues to expand due to a popular following amongst their patients and an excellent community reputation. They are committed to helping all of their team reach their potential; professionally and personally, and provide all the support necessary for you to reach your goals in a caring, fun and supportive environment.

They offer an attractive salary with great performance incentives, so you're rewarded for your hard work. Whether you‚Äôre a young energetic practitioner looking for an inspiring practice to leapfrog years in your learning curve, or you‚Äôre more experienced and want to expand your career opportunities and reach your true potential, we would love to hear from you. You get a work life freedom; you get accelerated career progression. Double your patient impact. Building your skill set and be a vital team member.

This clinic is accessible via public transport.

info@recruittherapists.co.uk

Our employment offers are subject to receipt of satisfactory pre-employment checks. At Recruit Therapists Ltd we actively promote diversity and equal opportunities. Applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

title: Associate Osteopath Little Chalfont (Buckinghamshire)
content:
We have a fantastic opportunity for an energetic and enthusiastic Associate Osteopath to be a part of our busy clinic based in Little Chalfont (Buckinghamshire) 

Osteopath Rakhee Mediratta is an experienced established practitioner (15 years+) working full time using a combination of osteopathy, The Perrin Technique, Neurolymphatic drainage and Craniosacral therapy, treating patients with ME/CFS, Lyme Disease, Fibromyalgia, post-viral fatigue and now Long-Covid. Rakhee's busy practice has an ever-increasing waiting list and she is looking for an associate to start taking on some of the newer patients. This role requires an interest and understanding in the above conditions from ME/CFS to Long Covid.


Here is a link to our website and more information about The Perrin Technique. https://www.rakheeosteopathylondon.co.uk


Responsibilities

As an Osteopath you will be responsible for providing a high standard of assessment, diagnosis, evaluation, treatment and advice to private patients. This role would be suited to a qualified osteopath with at least 1 year minimum experience in Osteopathy and some Cranial background. Additional experience in cupping, dry needling, sports injuries/massage, paediatric osteopathy, Myofascial release therapy or other alternative therapies are desirable. If not already trained in The Perrin Technique, you will be required to complete a 2 day course in Manchester with the founder of the Perrin Technique treatment, Dr Raymond Perrin.


Qualifications

We welcome applications and questions from graduates with at least a minimum of one year of experience and some cranial background to the more experienced. If you have recently graduated and are looking to specialise in the area of CFS/ME this role could be suited to you. Similarly if you have had experience treating CFS/ME, Fibromyalgia and even Long Covid, and are looking to develop your expertise and expand your patient list we would be interested in hearing from you.


Part-time 
Thursday 

Saturday 

Sunday
to be discussed in more detail - may be required to travel and work from our clinics in central London

title: Osteopath - Relocate to Australia
content:
Who are we

Established in 2019, InterHealthcare is a growing national allied health business partnering with reputable and leading allied health practices across Australia. Our 20 partner brands have been operating and supporting our communities across Australia for over 20 years.

Across our partner brands, we have over 70 operating practices and offer a multidisciplinary organisation embracing varied allied health disciplines and scopes. Our organisational vision is to bring together leaders in the field to create a national network of allied health businesses and services providers and in doing so, positively impact on the health and wellbeing of the Australian population.

Our Opportunity

We now have opportunities for qualified Osteopaths to join our Canberra City Health Network practices on an employer sponsored visa. Servicing the Canberra community for over 10 years, Canberra City Health Network have three practices across the Canberra area and are well known for industry leading Osteopathy services within a multi-modality allied health environment. Our beautiful practices are well equipped, in easy to access locations and are a fantastic place to continue your Osteopathy career.

Located in Australia's Capital Territory, Canberra has so much to offer including:

The political centre of Australia including our Parliament House and Museum of Australian Democracy
One of Australia's most affordable top cities
Fantastic amenities with so much to do
Minimal traffic on your daily commute
Easy to get around via car, bike paths or light rail
We are passionate about our team and offer a supportive environment to work and grow your career. 
Connect in with our practices to learn some of the exciting initiatives we are a part of. 

If you are looking to make the move to Australia with a reputable and national allied health organisation, private practice environment and fantastic location, this opportunity would be perfect for you.

About you:

As a qualified Osteopath you will be passionate about making a difference in the lives of others. In addition you will have:

A minimum level of degree qualification
Registered with an industry association
Willingness to pursue qualification equivalency and registration with the relevant Australian associations
A commitment to InterHealthcare for the duration of the employer sponsored visa
Willingness to work full time
Able to comply with relevant state government covid vaccination health mandates (more information can be provided)
At least two years of experience working as an Osteopath in order to be eligible for an organisational sponsored visa or ability to attain your own Australian working visa

We can offer

Join Canberra City Health Network and InterHealthcare for support with not just your move to Australia but the opportunity to develop your career. With so many practices and industry leading professionals across our national network, no matter your passion or career objective, we can connect you in with an experienced and likeminded team.

Our business also offers:

Monthly industry webinars that contribute towards your CPD
Continuous professional development
Mentoring by senior staff
Ability to connect in with industry leaders across our network to pursue your areas of interest
A stable and growing national business
Supportive and friendly private practice environment
Visa sponsorship for your move to Australia
Our opportunities are offered on either a 485 or 482 employer sponsored visa, you can find out more about employer sponsored visas via the Australian government website - https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/visa-listing

Find out more and how to apply

Please visit our website to find out more about InterHealthcare - https://interhealthcare.com.au/ or about Canberra City Health Network - https://www.canberrahealthnetwork.com.au/

Before you apply for this position, please visit the Australian Osteopathic Accreditation Council website to find out more about gaining qualification equivalency in Australia - https://osteopathiccouncil.org.au/qualification-skills-assessment/

If this opportunity sounds perfect for you, please apply via the link below. To discuss this opportunity further, contact the IHC HR team on +61 07 3186 6440 for a confidential chat or reach out via email or our website - www.interhealthcare.com.au

title: Senior Osteopath
content:

We all try to help each other get the best for our patients and our mission is to bring evidence-informed person-centred care where the aim isn't to keep patients coming indefinitely for maintenance sessions but build their self-efficacy so they don't need us as soon as possible.

Why us?

Helping people is what we're all about and that starts with you, looking after our team is the most important aspect of having a happy successful clinic so if you fit in with our mission then we'll do all we can to help you in the way you want to grow.

Keen to search for the root cause
Do you consider patients from a biopsychosocial viewpoint and help them understand this? Do you routinely search for the root cause of the issue and provide a diagnosis of ‚Äòwhy and how‚Äô in order to help them resolve the issue rather than just treating what is injured?

Provide evidence-informed care
Do you work in a way that has a strong rationale so you can bring your patients with you on the journey of solving their longstanding issues?

title: Employed Osteopath/Chiropractor
content:
At Back2Life Clinics, we aspire to deliver excellent, consistent and reliable care across the whole team. Each of us will constantly be developing our approach, and yet at the same time, there is a need for common standards and procedures. At Back2Life Clinics, we have a standardised initial consultation and patient care systems to ensure all our patients receive consistently excellent patient outcomes across the whole team. 

Below is an outline of the role and responsibilities of an osteopath/chiropractor at Back2Life Clinics:


Develop a thriving list of patients

‚Ä¢	Excellent retention ‚Äì consistently busy osteopaths/chiropractors have excellent retention
‚Ä¢	Expert mindset, giving the best clinical recommendations and care
‚Ä¢	Making each patient feel special, remembering them & what is important to them
‚Ä¢	Bring optimism, calm and ease to each consultation, so the patient feels at home
‚Ä¢	Being well prepared for each patient
‚Ä¢	Clear treatment plan and re-evaluation (as per iO recommendations)
‚Ä¢	Patients are enthusiastic about their treatment program because the goals are clear -
‚Ä¢	Avoid mid-treatment plan cancellations/self-discharge through the patient being aware of the next step and the goals of the subsequent appointment/re-evaluation
‚Ä¢	Proactive management of non-rebooking new patients, DNA‚Äôs and non-rebooking cancellations following our systems
‚Ä¢	Educate the patient about the scope of osteopathy
‚Ä¢	Following up and treating secondary issues
‚Ä¢	Advice is given on future check-ups or maintenance. 
‚Ä¢	Asking for Google reviews 
‚Ä¢	Saying thank you for reviews and referrals 
‚Ä¢	Timely and effective use of your google sheets
‚Ä¢	Timely and efficient follow-up calls/texts 
‚Ä¢	Invite the patient to call if they have any worries

Patient Consultations 

‚Ä¢	To take high-quality histories, using our consolation process, to establish the patient‚Äôs goals and aspirations
‚Ä¢	In-depth examination, understanding why the patient was vulnerable to the issue they present with
‚Ä¢	Giving the best clinical recommendations
‚Ä¢	Formulate a treatment plan and agree on this with the patient
‚Ä¢	Effective treatment, using the best approaches for that patient
‚Ä¢	Write up notes that are high quality, including objectives for the next visit.
‚Ä¢	Re-evaluate the patient‚Äôs progress and feedback to them on the next steps
‚Ä¢	Take charge of the patient‚Äôs care, review previous advice and exercises, modify if required
‚Ä¢	Review ergonomics, lifestyle & exercise that is currently being followed and make sure it is in alignment with our objectives. 
‚Ä¢	Manage patients effectively, so they complete their treatment program, rather than dropping out when symptoms resolve.
‚Ä¢	Offer to address secondary issues at the appropriate time
‚Ä¢	When stuck, confused, or if is a lack of progress, seek a second opinion swiftly
‚Ä¢	Run to time

Patient Care and Support - Proactive

‚Ä¢	Follow up email with an outline of the agreed treatment plan following 1st consultation
‚Ä¢	Post-treatment admin, letters, referral, links to information etc
‚Ä¢	Follow up with expectant mothers when they have given birth, send card when appropriate to congratulate
‚Ä¢	Follow up on non-rebooking NPs ‚Äì On the day 
‚Ä¢	Follow up on cancellations
‚Ä¢	Follow up on DNA‚Äôs
‚Ä¢	If a patient is more than 5 mins late to call if the reception team are busy
‚Ä¢	Check in with patients at difficult times, surgery, bereavement, illness etc

Helping the practice run smoothly

‚Ä¢	Be on time for all meetings & well prepared with iPad/pen & paper
‚Ä¢	Complete any practice admin within the agreed time framework
‚Ä¢	Start and finish your patient appointments on time. 
‚Ä¢	Always leave your room clean and tidy so it is ready for anyone to see a patient there.
‚Ä¢	Acknowledge emails

City Osteopaths Healthcare Est. 1992, is a warm, caring, professional practice with a very large patient base and excellent reputation and referrals from GPs, Midwives, allied health professionals, and specialists.

title: Associate Osteopath - North Yorkshire
content:
This is a great opportunity for an Osteopath to join our team, working in wonderful North Yorkshire. 

About Us
‚óè Northallerton Osteopaths was established in 1994. It is one of the largest multi-disciplinary complementary healthcare clinics in North Yorkshire, with 12 practitioners boasting over 200 years of clinical experience between them. Our ethos is to provide the best healthcare utilizing a patient-centred approach. All our associate practitioners are highly qualified and are regulated and insured by their respective professional bodies. Utilising modern approaches, and incorporating evidence-based practice, our practitioners work together as a team to provide the best possible treatment to our patients.
‚óè The Northallerton Osteopaths Ltd is based at Hale House, Northallerton. The two clinic directors also run Hale House Management, a company which oversees the maintenance of the building and hire of the office spaces and studio. 
‚óè We also have a satellite clinic, Easingwold Osteopaths, based in Easingwold, North Yorkshire which is 20 miles south of Northallerton.

The Role of the Associate Osteopath
‚óè Northallerton Osteopaths is an Osteopath led multi-disciplinary practice. Our Osteopaths see approx. 75% of all patients who visit the clinic. Our Osteopaths set the professional tone of the clinic and often lead the patient management plans of complex cases, referring appropriately to other practitioners within the clinic. They are often the ‚Äòface‚Äô of the clinic and set the tone for the positive experiences that our patients enjoy.
‚óè Our Osteopaths are required to manage their own patient list effectively, generating your own goodwill within the framework of the clinic.
‚óè You are also responsible for some administration relating to patient management such as telephone enquiries and follow up courtesy calls; diary management; GP letters; MRI referrals etc.
‚óè It is important that you have a professional relationship with our clinic manager and receptionists, so that they can fulfil their role in supporting our practitioners to work efficiently. 

Qualifications
‚óè UK based Osteopathy Qualification, or evidence of permission to work in the UK as an Osteopath
‚óè Registration with the General Osteopathic Council
‚óè Current Professional Indemnity Insurance

‚óè Employed (Full-time role): Starting salary circa ¬£28k with bonus scheme worth an additional potential of a further ¬£10K.
‚óè CPD allowance and registration fees paid.
‚óè Self Employed (part-time role only): % split dependant on level of experience.
‚óè We encourage our practitioners to find their own style of Osteopathy using all approaches including structural and/or cranial work.
‚óè We have regular catch-up meetings to support your CPD.
‚óè This full-time position can be on either a self-employed or employed basis.
‚óè We can offer help with relocation.

If interested, please e-mail Jo Waterworth on: joanna@halehousenorthallerton.co.uk
