content:
Associate position in Woburn, Bedfordshire

Woburn Osteopaths are looking for an associate osteopath to join our friendly, experienced, supportive and professional team of multi-disciplinary practitioners.  

Our clinic is a unique, converted old fire station located in the centre of the beautiful village of Woburn.  We have an excellent community reputation and we are looking to expand to due to high clinical demand.  

This opportunity is on a part-time, self-employed basis (2-3 days per week).  The new team member will take on a busy list of new and returning patients from our longstanding, loyal patient base.
The position would best suit an osteopath with experience; however, we welcome applications from new graduates too.

The team offers training and support, in-house CPD presentations and regular social events.  

The desired qualities in the ideal candidate are:

‚Ä¢ Strong structural skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Well-developed clinical reasoning
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage a busy list of patients

Please contact Nikki with your CV and a cover letter if you are interested in applying and/or have any further questions: info@woburnosteopaths.co.uk / 01525 290615.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Thank you very much.

Luke and Nikki Johnson

title: Freelance Osteopath
content:
I am posting this ad on behalf of the lovely independent multidisciplinary clinic I have been renting a room with in Peckham for the last 5 years. I am moving away due to changes in life, but I have had a an interesting and busy practice here for nearly 5 years.

Only 5 minutes walk from Peckham Rye station, it's in a great area, lots of professionals and families. I have seen a mix of patients over the years, including some elderly, and a  good proportion of babies too.

The women who run the clinic are friendly and supportive, but fairly hands off, so you can build your practice as you like. I have worked structurally and cranially, as did the practitioner before me, but there is no specific requirement for this.

The rent has historically been low, so it's fairly easy to make decent money even from just one day's work per week.

Take a look at bellendentherapies.co.uk to find out more about the clinic. You can either contact them direct, or contact me and I will put you in touch with the owners.

title: Associate Position - paediatric/cranial/classical
content:
We are looking to replace a beloved member of our team, who has worked in the clinic and built a successful list over the last 8 years.
The list is 25% paediatric, treating babies from birth, but also helping adults of all ages.
The treatment style has been a blend of structural, classical and cranial.
There are three other osteopaths in the team who work mostly structurally and with rehab, so we have always benefitted from a variety of approaches.
The clinic is family-run, set in a business park in Ascot. We are friendly and efficient and have good local relations with doctors and surgeons.
There is full-time reception cover and in-house CPD.

title: Osteopath Role in Sydney, Australia
content:
Located in Sydney on the Upper North Shore we are seeking a dedicated Osteopath to join our team. The Osteopathic Centre has been established in Hornsby for over 25 years and we have developed a strong reputation in the local community. This position is taking over a busy client list from a full time Osteopath who is relocating internationally. This opportunity is for those considering either a full time or part time role, is very well remunerated and offers the potential to gain equity or ownership of the practice in the future.
Located in the centre of Hornsby we have great transport links to the city and the bush. This is Sydney at it‚Äôs best; the tranquility of open spaces, nature, wildlife, trails and National Parklands and only a short 45 minute train ride to Sydney Town Hall.
We are a small team of 3 Osteos and 2 Massage Therapists with regular team meetings and a well developed mentoring program. The successful applicant will possess strong communication skills, be passionate about Osteopathy and the many facets of our profession and have a strong desire to grow professionally and personally.
Ideally, we‚Äôre looking for someone to start asap. Please send your resume and a covering letter to deepak@osteocentre.com.au

title: Associate osteopath
content:
MG are recruiting!

MG Osteopathy and Personal Training are looking for an enthusiastic, self-employed osteopath and/or personal trainer and/or massage therapist to join our team.

We have a rent-free treatment room and personal training studio available within our clinic at the famous Holborn Studios, N1.

At the moment we are looking to fill Tuesdays but there is scope to take on more days/shifts as your list builds.

We can offer:
- A rent-free treatment room in a prime London location N1
- A private personal training studio directly adjacent for you to rehab/train your patients in
- A 50/50 fee split
- Flexible 3, 6 or 9 hour shifts
- The option to build your list as a pro-active member of the MG team or bring your own patients with you

We would like:
- Minimum 1-year experience
- Excellent structural skills as a minimum, other approaches also welcomed on top of this
- Someone who is confident working alone as well as a great team participant
- Willingness to remain at the clinic for your entire shift and open/close the premises when required to
- Someone who is driven to sell themselves and the MG Clinic on social media

Even better if you have: an interest or background in personal training, fitness and rehab, or qualifications in other therapies such as dry needling, cupping or massage.

This is a great opportunity to join an exciting new London clinic.

The position will begin with a 1-month trial period and the option of observing at the clinic prior to joining.

We will start interviewing a.s.a.p, please send your CV and cover letter to info@mgosteopathy.com, or feel free to contact us for more info or a chat on the phone.

We look forward to meeting you!

title: Osteopath
content:
Want to earn $50/patient? Or $100/hr? That's how much I need you to be an osteo with me! Thinking you'd like to have your own clinic one day? This is a great opportunity to get a head start. 

Want to walk straight into a busy schedule but want a sea change? 

I started Warrnambool Osteo 18 months ago and am flat off my feet and need help! 

I'm flexible about the employment arrangements and am happy to discuss employment or independent contracting. I currently work 2 days a week and see 40 patients in that time. The hours/days are flexible too and can be tailored to meet your lifestyle. I am no longer taking new clients or accepting CDM referrals as i just can't fit them in. 

You do need to have a strong, structural practice to be able to cater to the client's i have and am attracting to the business. My clinic is located in a well established rustic log cabin alongside chinese medicine, bowen, and massage.  

I can provide mentoring both osteo or/and business after having been in business for 12years, and selling a busy staffed multidisciplinary clinic a couple of years ago. 

If you'd like to know more, please send me an email to erin@warrnamboolosteo.com.au. Students are welcome to apply. 

Thanks, Erin

title: Associate
content:
The Holmes Clinic is looking for a new member of our growing team. With increasing number of patients, we are in need of a driven, self-motivated clinician. 

Who we are looking for:
We are looking for a clinician who is willing to learn ‚Äì whether an osteopath or a physiotherapist: with the right mind-set and drive you will fit perfectly into the clinic.

We are more than happy to take a new graduate or an experienced clinician ‚Äì with an interest or experience of rehabilitation and sports. 

The Role
Primarily be based in our clinic ‚Äì working out of both our Waipu and Whangarei locations. There is an option to work pitch-side at trainings and match days with one of our sponsored sports team in either football or rugby union. 

The Clinic:
The Holmes Clinic was established in 2017, by BSO graduate Neil Holmes and has been growing in reputation and stature within the Whangarei and Waipu locations. We set out on the journey to provide the best evidence-based osteopathy and rehabilitation to all of our patients. 

We have a very good referral network to specialist and other osteopathic clinics across Whangarei ‚Äì working together for a better result for our patients. 

The clinic uses Gensolve, so we are paperless ‚Äì all the ACC claims are submitted electronically; full training will be provided. 

To apply:
Please send your CV and cover letter to Neil Holmes, Director of The Holmes Clinic
theholmesclinic@outlook.co.nz
